metadata.titel_preek: Save Us in the Time of Trial, and Deliver Us from the Evil One

locutie.beschrijving: The preacher explains the apocalyptic context of the Lord's Prayer, shifting from historical persecution (Egypt, Nazis, Apartheid) to the contemporary 'daily grind' as a site of cosmic battle.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Strong focus on the shift from 'temptation' to 'time of trial' and the 'Evil One' as a personal force.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting historical and theological facts, with a late shift toward encouraging and charging the congregation.
voorbeelden: The Lord’s Prayer has an apocalyptic context.
Evil has a life of its own.
I charge you to keep the commandment.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To make the hearer aware of the gravity of their daily choices as part of a cosmic struggle.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit. Mention of the 'Sword of the Spirit' in scripture, but little explicit reliance on the Spirit's current work in the preaching act.

voorbeelden: The subject was political conditions in Egypt.
World War II was an apocalyptic time.
I have always been pretty sure...
I can assure you that my courage fails.
We shall overcome... because our Lord has overcome.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Weak. The promises are mostly quoted from scripture rather than being enacted by the preacher in the present tense.

voorbeelden: I charge you to keep the commandment (quoted from 1 Tim).
declaratieven.autoriteit: Low. The preacher quotes Paul's authority rather than speaking with delegated sacramental authority.

indicatoren: Extensive historical anecdotes (Egypt, Nazis, South Africa).
Long explanations of scholarly translation shifts.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes a spectator of history and theology rather than a participant in a divine encounter.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is given a 'to-do list' (Directives) without the 'done' (Commissives) to fuel it.

voorbeelden: We will be upheld by the Savior.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Personal anecdotes and 'we' as a collective of seekers.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Late in the sermon to apply the 'apocalyptic' to daily life.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Mostly used for questions and directives, not promises.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing historical figures and biblical characters.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a lecture-like atmosphere for the first 70% of the text.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological definitions of evil and prayer.

voorbeelden: Evil has a life of its own... Aim at righteousness!
foutief_patroon.probleem: The 'Promise' (Toezegging) is missing as the bridge, leading to moralism.

voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: We'll miss the target many times, but we'll keep on aiming.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a high-level lecture on the apocalyptic nature of the Lord's Prayer but fails to enact the 'deliverance' it describes.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The shift from 'temptation' to 'time of trial'.
sterke_punten.effect: Clarifies the biblical text's original weight.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: I wonder if we... might begin to think afresh.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Too tentative; lacks the 'Thus says the Lord' authority.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is an event of 'learning about' God, not an 'encounter with' God.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher remains a commentator rather than a mandatory of the Word.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: No. God is the object of discussion.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Weak. The preacher speaks as a fellow searcher ('If you're like me').
tekstueel_bewijs: I realize that the interpretation... I'm offering tonight.
The sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God (Quote only).

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: No. The sermon is a 'rethinking' exercise.
tekstueel_bewijs: It’s a common undertaking for all of us... to rethink the Lord’s Prayer.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many past-tense assertives. Needs present-tense commissives.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The Lord’s Prayer has an apocalyptic context.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Tonight, the Lord speaks to you in your trial.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: Grace is a footnote to human endurance.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Declare Christ's victory over the hearer's specific 'Evil One'.
voorbeeldzinnen: Christ has already overcome the darkness you face in your workplace.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use 'You' to bring the battle to the pews earlier.
voorbeeldzinnen: You are standing at the frontier where the ages meet.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: Imperatives (Aim! Fight!) lack the fuel of the Indicative (You are saved!).
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Base the call to endurance on the finished work of Christ.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is intellectually stimulating but homiletically 'safe'. To become a sacramental event, it must move from 'talking about' the battle to 'arming' the congregation through the performative Word.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's self-revelation (fear of torture); SAT reveals the lack of a 'Declarative' act that changes the hearer's status.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetorically, the anecdotes are powerful; illocutionarily, they are merely descriptive (Assertive).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT exposes that despite the 'dramatic' content, the linguistic force remains static and constative.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: By your endurance you will gain your lives.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Places the burden on the hearer.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'Locution' of the biblical quotes to do the performative work, rather than the preacher's own illocutionary act.
